front.text: You can go to the beach provided that you put sunblock on.

back.text: If you put sunblock on, then you can go to the beach. All times you put sunblock on are times you can go to the beach.

front.text: Graduating seniors are required to pick up their cap and gown by Friday.

back.text: If you are a graduating senior, then you should pick up your cap and gown by Friday. All graduating seniors are people who should pick up their cap and gown by Friday.
If it rains, it pours. All times it rains are times when it pours.

front.text: Unless the electric bill was paid, the house will be dark.

back.text: If the electric bill was not paid, then the house will be dark. OR If the house is not dark, then the electric bill was paid. All times the electric bill was not paid are times the house is dark.

front.text: Dani wears sandals only if it is hot.

back.text: If Dani wears sandals, then it is hot. All times Dani wears sandals are times when it is hot. [Note that the word only affects the logical meaning.]
